For example, Kim et al. developed [Mg 2(μ-Cl) 3·6THF][HMDSAlCl 3] (THF = tetrahydrofuran, HMDS = hexamethyldisilazane) and used it in a Mg/S battery
9 . Doe et al. reported a magnesium aluminum chloride complex (MACC) and showed that this electrolyte, comprising fully inorganic salts, can be used in a magnesium battery
16, 17 . In recent years, it has also been reported that even an electrolyte without a Lewis acid causes magnesium plating/stripping. For example, Mg(TFSI) 2/triglyme (TFSI = bistriflimide) showed high electrochemical stability toward oxidation and can cause reversible magnesium plating/stripping
18– 20 . A carborane-based electrolyte without a Lewis acid was also reported to exhibit high Coulombic efficiency and high anodic stability for SUS and Al electrodes
21– 24 .
